content: With the lastest update to sushi, sushi could not resolve the package IHE.ITI.PIXm#3.0.0 anymore, if the dependency is only provided in the implementation guide resources and not sushi-config.yml, see details here. I think it makes sense to change the package name in the next release to lowercase, but maybe someone stumbles over the same problem ...
HI @Oliver Egger. That's not intentional. We'll take a look at it to see if we can provide a fix so it continues to work as it did before.
I sure did cause you lots of pain this release... :-)
I nominate @Chris Moesel as the FHIR Grinch for 2021!
I hope I am more like the Grinch at the end of the movie than the Grinch at the start of the movie!
You've stolen all the IG love. We're waiting for your heart to grow three sizes and release a fixed version of sushi

OK, @Oliver Egger and @John Moehrke -- the brand new SUSHI 2.2.3 release handles this much better now! And by that I mean it actually loads the dependency despite the mixed case.

@David Pyke - am I invited to the Who Feast now?
You can even carve the roast fish
@Chris Moesel thanks a lot, I can confirm that 2.2.3 is handling upper case package names without sushi-config.yml :+1:
note, I am moving (eventually) IHE to lowercase. Will take some time for governance.
